channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Signal President Meredith Whittaker calls out agentic AI as having ‘profound’ security and privacy issues
item.description: Signal President Meredith Whittaker warned Friday that agentic AI could come with a risk to user privacy. Speaking onstage at the SXSW conference in A...

item.title: This Split Mattress Topper Made for Partners Who Can’t Agree
item.description: If you and your partner have different sleeping styles and debate over how soft or firm a mattress should be, the answer is this split topper.

item.title: The Extreme Weather Conditions That Drove the Carolina Wildfires
item.description: The wildifires in the Carolinas have followed months of whiplash weather—drought, followed by hurricane-fueled floods, and then more drought.

item.title: How to Get Windows Games Working on a Mac
item.description: If the game you want to play is only available for Windows, here are three things you can try to get it running on your Mac.

item.title: The Biggest US Banks Have All Backed Out of a Commitment to Reach Net Zero
item.description: In the lead up to the inauguration, the six largest US banks left a voluntary alliance with the UN to reach net zero by 2050. Now, critics are calling...

item.title: Comfort Colors T-Shirts Are the Only Thing I’ll Wear
item.description: I happened upon the budget brand at a chintzy souvenir shop in Maine. I've since sworn full allegiance to the cult of Comfort Colors.

item.title: SXSW 2025: What we’re paying attention to
item.description: TechCrunch will be on the ground at SXSW 2025 — the annual tech, music, comedy, and film conference that kicked off Friday in Austin — in search of th...

item.title: In defense tech, Lithuania’s sovereign VC fund is one step ahead
item.description: Europe is waking up to the need to invest in defense, and so are European VCs. But with a painful history of Soviet occupations, Lithuania didn’t wait...

item.title: Microsoft reportedly ramps up AI efforts to compete with OpenAI
item.description: Microsoft is accelerating its push to compete with OpenAI, its longtime collaborator, by developing its own powerful AI models and exploring alternati...

item.title: Cursor in talks to raise at a $10B valuation as AI coding sector booms
